generif.text: TIFA induces the oligomerization and polyubiquitination of TRAF6, which leads to the activation of TAK1 and IKK through a proteasome-independent mechanism
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)

identify a novel threonine phosphorylation site on TIFA and show that this phosphorylated threonine binds with the FHA domain of TIFA, leading to TIFA oligomerization and TIFA-mediated NF-kappaB activation

an innate immune signaling axis, mediated by phosphorylation-dependent oligomerization of the TRAF-interacting protein with forkhead-associated domain (TIFA) that is triggered by heptose-1,7-bisphosphate.
This study reports the crystal structures of TIFA (residues 1-150, with the unstructured C-terminal tail truncated) and its complex with the N-terminal phosphothreonine9 peptide (residues 1-15).
TIFA is a crucial mediator in the endothelial innate immune response by potentiating and amplifying NLRP3 inflammasome via augmenting signals 1 and 2
we report that Aurora A is essential for phosphorylation of the TRAF-interacting protein TIFA
These results define TIFA as a rheostat for intracellular bacterial replication, escalating the immune response to invasive Gram-negative bacteria that exploit the host cytosol for growth.

study revealed that host TIFA and H. pylori-derived heptose-1,7-bisphosphate are critical effectors of innate immune signaling that account for much of the inflammatory response to H. pylori in gastric epithelial cells
TIFA expression limited proliferation of multiple myeloma cancer cells. In conclusion these results indicate that TIFA functions as a key transducer in DNA damage-induced NF-kappaB activation

TIFA may serve as a biomarker in the prediction of lung adenocarcinoma. Furthermore, TIFA may modulate lung cancer cell survival and proliferation through regulating the synthesis of apoptosis-associated proteins.
The results provide direct evidence and a structural basis for the TIFA-TRAF6 interaction, and show how this important biological function can be modulated.

REVIEW: various mechanisms and pathways involved in H. pylori induction of NF-kappaB-dependent responses in gastric epithelial cells, including a 'state-of-the-art' review on the respective roles of NOD1 and ALPK1/TIFA pathways in these responses
TIFA and TIFAB: FHA-domain proteins involved in inflammation, hematopoiesis, and disease.
The ALPK1/TIFA/NF-kappaB axis links a bacterial carcinogen to R-loop-induced replication stress.
TIFA protein expression is associated with pulmonary arterial hypertension.
TIFA has dual functions in Helicobacter pylori-induced classical and alternative NF-kappaB pathways.
TIFA promotes colorectal cancer cell proliferation in an RSK- and PRAS40-dependent manner.
The potential biomarker TIFA regulates pyroptosis in sepsis-induced acute kidney injury.

wikipathways.name: Regulation of toll-like receptor signaling pathway
Simplified Depiction of MYD88 Distinct Input-Output Pathway

summary: This gene encodes an adapter protein involved in adaptive and innate immunity. This protein includes a forkhead-associated (FHA) domain that specifically binds to phosphorylated serine and threonine residues. In response to bacterial infection, the encoded host cell protein undergoes an intermolecular interaction between the FHA domain and a phosphorylated threonine that leads to protein oligomerization and stimulation of the NF-kappa B and other downstream signaling pathways. This protein exhibits reduced expression in hepatocellular carcinoma and may suppress hepatocellular carcinoma progression. This protein may also play a role in the DNA damage response. [provided by RefSeq, Jun 2018].
